someone who tries to be popular with ordinary people and to represent their ideas and opinions: a political party dominated by populists He's a populist who promised to end tax breaks for the rich and break up monopolies.
More examplesFewer examplesRight-wing populists claim immigrants are stealing jobs. He gained the reputation of being a populist who worked on behalf of the rural poor. These populists tend to be from the working and middle classes rather than the professional classes.
